docs.lead_paragraph: Flush with financial clout and with their eyes on pushing Congress to further loosen laws, medical marijuana industry leaders are forming a national trade association.

docs.lead_paragraph: As an aging population threatens to overwhelm America’s hospitals and doctors, thousands of seriously ill patients are relying on computerized health trackers.

docs.lead_paragraph: As more families find themselves enrolled in health plans with high deductibles, they are increasingly likely to delay or forgo medical care because of the out-of-pocket cost, a new study shows.
docs.abstract: A new study indicates that families with higher deductibles on their health plans may be delaying medical care or going without.
docs.snippet: A new study indicates that families with higher deductibles on their health plans may be delaying medical care or going without.

docs.lead_paragraph: The week's biggest news may be this morning's announcement from the Department of Health and Human Services about the final rules under the new health care law that dictate how health insurers must spend the premiums they collect.
docs.abstract: The much-debated regulations for the insurance industry have been released.
docs.snippet: The much-debated regulations for the insurance industry have been released.

docs.lead_paragraph: Nancy Folbre is an economics professor at the University of Massachusetts Amherst.
docs.abstract: Missing from the recent proposals and how to cut the budget deficit through spending cuts and tax increases is any analysis of which people are most affected by what, an economist writes.

docs.lead_paragraph: More than a few Republicans know that while the politics of trying to curb funding is appealing, any wholesale repeal of major provisions of the health care overhaul is likely to generate a backlash.

docs.lead_paragraph: An article on Thursday about how Wisconsin might change the way it implements the new federal health care law under a new Republican governor who opposes the law misstated the professional background of Florida's governor-elect, Rick Scott, another Republican who strongly opposes the law. He was an executive of a chain of hospitals, not an insurance executive.
